intro: Ruschia lerouxiae, commonly known as the Kleinewynbos Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in arid environments.
